greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least common multiple of integers less than and prime to n.
comment: If n is a prime power, tau(a(n)) is the number of times n occurs in A034699. (If n is not a prime power, it does not occur in A034699.) - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Apr 01 2008
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..200
formula: a(n) = e^[Sum_{k=1..n} (1-floor(n^k/k)+floor((n^k -1)/k))*Mangoldt(k)] where Mangoldt is the Mangoldt function. - _Anthony Browne_, Jun 16 2016
example: Since 1, 5, 7, and 11 are relatively prime to 12, a(12) = LCM(1,5,7,11) = 385.
mathematica: Table[ LCM@@ Flatten[ Position[ GCD[ n, # ]& /@ Range[ n ], 1 ] ], {n, 32} ]
results.author: _Wouter Meeussen_
